description: The study of the anatomy and physiology of the human body is founded on a thorough
understanding of the structure and function of cells and tissues. Students attend lectures plus one
3-hour lab per week. Nursing and exercise science majors may pre-register for this course. This
course may not be taken after completion of Biology 125, Chemistry/Biology 227, or Biology 227,
all of which serve as a prerequisite for Biology 243: Human Anatomy and Physiology.
fullname: Human Anatomy and Physiology: Cells and Tissues
